name: Charles JordanLLC
text: I strongly recommend Regional Bail Bonds. They are great people and a great company to do business with even though the need for their business is unfortunate. I never knew anything about these places other than sometimes a building has a sign saying "Bail Bonds" or what you see on TV. Very typical for the law abiding citizen. I learned sometimes even a law abiding citizen can find themselves going through the legal process. Obviously, you don't plan it, or you wouldn't be in the situation. That's exactly why you should plan to find these people ahead of time and have them in your pocket, because you never know. As for my experience, Regional Bail Bonds answered the call quickly. Provided me the best advice they could in the situation, not legal advice of course. Their not attorneys and they will let you know that. Great people in some of life's roughest times. In my situation, they were able to partner with another Bond Company, to cover the higher bond. As a businessman myself, I know when two competitors can partner together instead of competing against another, that's great business with a relationship of trust and integrity. Together, they got me out of the lock up situation so I could continue to work and handle the process ahead fairly. I highly recommend Regional Bail Bonds, but I hope to never need them again! Thank you!

name: Bud Allen
text:
I was released, with no way to even leave the Detention Center.  Take off walking... Right?  Wish I could've...
Congestive heart failure, and a reconstructed right foot makes it difficult.  So, I was resting in the lobby when a man entered holding a clipboard.  He looked important, so I asked if he was a bail bondsman.  He said he was.
I asked if he could give me a ride to a place where a friend of mine works... I had four dollars; but it was on a card that you had to take to a certain bank.  He held a hand up.
He got on his phone; talked a bit, hung up and said someone would be there in seven minutes.  Then he gave me the green card, saying "Give me a rate and review... Just look us up on Google."
It never occurred to me to ask this man what his name was, I was too surprised about getting a lift, to think clearly.  Getting a stranger to give you a lift... from the Detention Center?!
All I can say, is Bless you, Sir...
You don't know how bad I needed a friend, right then...
Until we speak again, my friend...

resp.text: The bail agents name was Heath. Im glad he was able to help.

text: These people will do anything for money. They did no research on the situation before they took my ex husband  case. My ex-husband hires them to follow me. They went around showing a picture of me to neighbors and friends telling them I was a fugitive on the run. I have never been in trouble with the law. Not even a speeding ticket. They parked in front of my business and watched me. They followed me for weeks. At one point they cut me off at a red light that turned green. After being cut off I tailed them until they stopped and parked. They get out of the car and ask me what I am doing. I asked them why they have been following me? They denied everything but I have cell phone pictures to prove my case. These people will work for any low life and are a disgrace to the name of their profession.  Maybe I should file a lawsuit for defamation of character.  I rated them 1 star, but I didn’t have a choice. I had to give them a one so I could post my review.

resp.text:
Ms. Cochran, I think you have us confused with someone else, as we're a bail bond company. If you would like to speak to someone directly, I would be happy to address any concerns you may have.

name: Brandy Monroe
text: Authority Bails Bond was the most professional, knowledgeable, and helpful bonds company out of the 4 bonds companies I called. They were patient with me and informative over the phone and even more so in person. The owner, Agent Harper, was kind enough to explain everything I questioned about the process. He made it a bearable experience considering the circumstance and explained eveything step by step. I was very impressed considering the other companies I called couldn't answer my questions and one company even took over 2hrs to return my call. They were welcoming and Agent Brittany was thorough, and kept me on track completing my paperwork though I was upset and needed a good bit to be explained through the process. They are meticulous of your time and explain how the process takes place through real time expectation. If you want to be dealt with like you and your family or friends matter through a time of devastation, Authority Bails Bond is who I recommend. They really work with you. Thanks Mr.Harper. You guys are truly appreciated!

name: Dixie Mae
text: I'm just going to guess that the 2 five star reviews are granddaughter and friend or friend and son or people paid to review things well, because, from my experience, 1 star is all they get. USE SOMEONE ELSE!! We were wrong in Alabama and we handled it. We were arrested on a misdemeanor marijuana charge and live in another state. We agreed on 15%, instead of normal 10%. After we are released, they "offered" us a ride, 2 miles to where we had to pay to get our car out of impound. The owner and his wife would send our receipt by email and gave me the change from our friends who had sent bail money. Upon receiving our receipts, these people took 20% of our bond and charged us $65 for the trip to our car. When we asked them about it, we were basically told to get bent. So, if you want to get screwed in Alabama, let these people do it. Otherwise find another bondsman and line his pockets. Not sure how these work exactly, but I have a screenshot of this in case they can remove it and I have proof of everything I said, in case they want to challenge it.
